## Overview

GeoSurrogates.jl provides several types of surrogate models for geospatial data:

### Classical Surrogates

- [`LinReg`](classical.qmd#linreg) - Linear regression surrogate
- [`RasterWrap`](classical.qmd#rasterwrap) - Interpolation-based surrogate
- [`CategoricalRasterWrap`](classical.qmd#categoricalrasterwrap) - Kernel smoothing for categorical data
- [`GeomWrap`](classical.qmd#geomwrap) - Geometry-based influence surrogate

### Neural Network Surrogates

- [`ImplicitTerrain.MLP`](neural.qmd#implicitterrainmlp) - Single SIREN network
- [`ImplicitTerrain.Model`](neural.qmd#implicitterrainmodel) - Cascaded SIREN for terrain
- [`WindSurrogate.WindSIREN`](neural.qmd#windsurrogatewindsiren) - SIREN for wind vector fields
- [`CategoricalSIREN.CatSIREN`](neural.qmd#categoricalsirencatsiren) - SIREN for categorical data

### Utilities

- [`normalize`](utilities.qmd#normalize) - Normalize data to [-1, 1]
- [`gaussian`](utilities.qmd#gaussian) - Gaussian kernel function
- [`predict`](utilities.qmd#predict) - Predict values from a surrogate
- [`fit!`](utilities.qmd#fit) - Train a neural network surrogate

## Common Interface

All surrogates implement the following interface:

```julia
# Predict at a single point
predict(surrogate, (x, y))

# Predict on a raster grid
predict(surrogate, raster)

# Get CRS (if available)
GeoInterface.crs(surrogate)

# Get extent (if available)
GeoInterface.extent(surrogate)
```

Neural network surrogates additionally support:

```julia
# Train the model
fit!(model, data; steps=1000)
```
